data.text:
Name B. J. or Barbara Robinson

Where are you from? Louisiana

A little about your self `ie your education Family life etc I have an Associate of Arts in Office Administration, a bachelor’s in Office Administration/Business Education, and a master’s in Curriculum/Instruction

Fiona: Tell us your latest news?

I recently published a new novel titled Louisiana Sunset, and I’m working on it’s sequel, Louisiana Sundown. I’m also working on a contemporary romance set in Florida.

Fiona: When and why did you begin writing?

I’ve been writing since the third grade when my short story was published in a local newspaper, my first college essay was published in another local paper, and a short story won first prize in college and was published in the university’s literary magazine. I’ve always loved writing from the third grade.

Fiona: When did you first consider yourself a writer?

When my short story won first prize and then I sold an article to the local newspaper.

Fiona: What inspired you to write your first book?

My mother’s superstitions and beliefs in God influenced me to write Southern Superstitions.

Fiona: Do you have a specific writing style?

Seat-of-the-pants mostly

Fiona: How did you come up with the title?

Titles are never a problem for me. I can come up with titles easy and from there go with a novel, which is what I usually do,

Fiona: Is there a message in your novel that you want readers to grasp?

Each novel has a theme that I hope my readers will grasp.

Fiona: How much of the book is realistic?

My books are fiction though I do use real travel experiences in my writing and life experience.

Fiona: Are experiences based on someone you know, or events in your own life?

Usually events in my own life, and I get ideas from music and travel.

Fiona: What books have most influenced your life most?

The Bible

Fiona: If you had to choose, which writer would you consider a mentor?

Eva Marie Everson because she was truly my writing mentor

Fiona: What book are you reading now?

Just finished The Best of Me by Nicholas Sparks

Fiona: Are there any new authors that have grasped your interest?

I buy many books by new authors. I especially enjoy Naomi Musch, though I can no longer say she’s a new author since she has several novels under her belt. I love the way she includes nature and vivid description in her novels.

Fiona: What are your current projects?

I just answered this question above. Louisiana Sundown and Love Beneath a Florida Sky

Fiona: Name one entity that you feel supported you outside of family members.

My critique group

Fiona: Do you see writing as a career?

Yes

Fiona: If you had to do it all over again, would you change anything in your latest book?

Yes, I always want to go back and make changes and improve then.

Fiona: Do you recall how your interest in writing originated?

I enjoy writing about my pets and family and was encouraged to continue writing by my family. Being published early on encouraged me to continue.

Fiona: Is there anything you find particularly challenging in your writing?

Finding the time to go back and improve older books since my writing has improved.

Fiona: Who is your favorite author and what is it that really strikes you about their work?

I love Nicholas Sparks because his novels are so powerful with love and romance stories, and I don’t consider them a cheesy romance because he includes real-life situations and even gets literary at times.

Fiona: Do you have to travel much concerning your book(s)?

No

Fiona: Who designed the covers?

I take my pictures, and my granddaughter or a friend makes my covers.

Fiona: What was the hardest part of writing your book?

Usually getting started is the hardest part for me. Once I get the first three chapters, I can keep going.

Fiona: Did you learn anything from writing your book and what was it?

There’s always room for improvement. Join a critique group so you can learn more than you will from any class. Read, read, read in your genre. Edit, edit, edit.

Fiona: Do you remember the first book you read?

Nancy Drew mysteries. Grew up on them.

Fiona: What makes you laugh/cry?

Sad stories and sad movies make me cry. Funny ones make me laugh. I’m an emotional woman.

Fiona: Is there one person pass or present you would meet and why?

I’d like to meet Eva Marie Everson, my writing mentor, one day. We worked together online.

Fiona: What do you want written on your head stone and why ?

Never thought about this, but perhaps. She lived, loved, and wrote.

Fiona: Other than writing do you have any hobbies ?

Fishing, gardening, cooking, reading

Fiona: What TV shows/films do you enjoy watching?

I don’t watch a lot of TV, but I love the Sherwood movies, Survivor, and Touched by an Angel. There are some old shows I really enjoyed watching years ago such as I love Lucy, Dick Van Dyke, The Wild, Wild West, and my favorite movie and book of all time is Gone With the Wind.

Fiona: Favorite foods / Colors/ Music Seafood, blue, country and gospel

Fiona: If you were not a writer what else would you like to have done?

Teach, and I did.

Fiona: Do you have a blog/website? If so what is it? http://barbarajrobinson.blogspot.com
